definition:
Let $K$, $n$, $r_1$, $r_2$,
$\{\varepsilon_n,\ldots,\varepsilon_{r-1}\}$, and $||\cdot||_i$ be as in
the entry regulator, but with $K$ taken to be a CM field.

Define the $p$-adic logarithm
$\log_p: {\mathbb}{C}_p^\times{\rightarrow}{\mathbb}{C}_p$ by
$$\begin{aligned}
\log_p(x)=-\sum_{k=1}^\infty \frac{(1-x)^k}{k}\end{aligned}$$

Let $A_{K,p}$ be the $(r-1)\times (r-1)$ matrix with general entry given
by $a_{i,j}=\log_p ||\varepsilon_j||_i$. The absolute value of the
determinant of this matrix is again independent of your choice of basis
for the units and of the ordering of the embeddings. This value is
called the *$p$-adic regulator of $K$,* and is denoted by $R_{p,K}$, or
$R_p(K)$.
